Foods to Avoid

8 Everyday Foods That Secretly Contain Hidden Maida

üë§
Editorial Team
‚Ä¢ October 14, 2025

Table of Contents

  • Why Maida Is a Health Concern
  • Foods That Commonly Hide Maida
  • 1. Biscuits & Cookies
  • 2. Pizza Bases
  • 3. Wraps & Rolls
  • 4. Cakes & Muffins
  • 5. Puffs, Patties & Samosas
  • 6. Croissants
  • 7. Breakfast Cereals
  • 8. Breads

New Delhi ‚Äî Many everyday foods that appear wholesome‚Äîlike biscuits, brown breads, rolls and cereals‚Äîquietly contain maida, the refined flour often called ‚Äúwhite poison‚Äù for its low nutritional value and high glycemic impact.

Maida is produced by finely milling wheat while stripping away the bran and germ. This leaves behind mostly starch, which spikes blood sugar and offers almost no vitamins, minerals, or fibre. Industrial processing may also involve bleaching agents like benzoyl peroxide to achieve its white appearance.

Why Maida Is a Health Concern

Regular consumption of maida-heavy foods contributes to increased blood glucose, weight gain, and reduced metabolic health. Despite the ‚Äúhealthy‚Äù labels, refined flour remains a dominant ingredient in many daily items.

Foods That Commonly Hide Maida

1. Biscuits & Cookies

Even products marketed as ‚Äúoat‚Äù or ‚Äúmultigrain‚Äù typically use maida as the primary base for structure and shelf life.

2. Pizza Bases

Most commercial pizza bases rely heavily on refined flour unless they clearly specify whole-wheat or alternative crusts.

3. Wraps & Rolls

Veggie wraps, kathi rolls and ready-made tortillas often contain high proportions of maida, even when sold as ‚Äúwhole wheat‚Äù.

4. Cakes & Muffins

The soft crumb in muffins and cakes comes from refined flour paired with sugar and fats‚Äînutritionally empty combinations.

5. Puffs, Patties & Samosas

The flaky layers in patties and puff pastries are possible only because of maida-based dough.

6. Croissants

Traditional croissants use multiple layers of maida dough and butter, making them high in refined carbs and unhealthy fats.

7. Breakfast Cereals

Many packaged breakfast cereals secretly use refined flour. Reading ingredient lists is essential for identifying whole-grain options.

8. Breads

Brown bread or multigrain bread often contains mostly maida with only traces of whole grains unless the label explicitly states ‚Äú100% whole wheat‚Äù.

Consumers can avoid hidden maida by checking labels carefully and choosing genuinely whole-grain or alternative-flour options.

Sources & References
